Ryan, an interesting side note.
When I returned to North America for my second job interview with Airline XYZ,I had to face the make or break "Board Interview" .
You sit down with a group of Senior Captains, who can ask you any questions they want.
I passed around my logbook, East African Commercial License, and pictures of the various aircraft I flew, maps to the Game Parks, etc. We talked about the DC-3s I had flown up to the Sudan out of Nairobi, too.
I had pictures of the house on the beach I shared with a German Pilot, and our three house servants. Fishermen came every day to sell us their fresh catch.
It was a cold, wet dreary day, raining outside for the interview. After talking about the flying and showing pictures of the wild game I had seen in the Masai Mara, and Amboseli, one of the Captains asked me, "Why are you here?" The next Captain said, "How can I get a job over there?"
So the interview had turned around quickly!

In addition to Look Ahead:

The Bushie's rationale for proposing the Authorization to Use Force was to use as a motivator for Saddam to start cooperating with weapons inspectors, and it worked in that regard. The weapons inspectors were allowed back in and reported cooperation and no findings of illegal weapons.

Despite all reassurances by the Bushies that use of military force would be the absolute last alternative, after a few months of successful engagement, the inspectors were abruptly pulled out and we invaded.

If Hillary is guilty of anything it is of having underestimated the capacity for duplicity of people in the Bush administration.

Hillary voted for war in Iraq. For many Sanders supporters, this is the sin that cannot be forgiven.

While I absolutely disagree with the decision to invade Iraq, it is important to consider the context of the Senate vote at the time. The Bush Administration had employed the CIA to concoct false intelligence reports that "proved" Saddam had WMD. Those reports were then shared in a dramatic presentation by Secretary of State Colin Powell at the United Nations. The target for said WMD was unquestionably Israel. The State of NY is keenly interested in the security of Israel.

HRC could have done a Joe Wilson "You Lie!" on the Senate floor, but lacking her own contravening intelligence operation, had to vote based on the information provided by the Executive to the Senators.

This was not an easy vote in the wake of the devastating impact of 9/11 on New York. Hilary says she regrets the vote. But she did enjoy an approval rating in the range of 75% through her two terms as NY Senator.

For those who like me who believe the Iraq War was the biggest foreign policy blunder since Vietnam, it is important to bear in mind that the criminal act was committed by the CIA and the President, rather than the Senate.

Gold, for better or for worse, removes the money supply from the control of the government.

If you lived in Venezuela, you wished that Chavez had issued you gold coins, not paper money. Even more so in Zimbabwe, under Mugabe.
You can buy 100 Trillion Zimbabwe Banknotes 100 Trillion Zimbabwe Banknotes from 2008 for $61.45 on line, should you wish to have something on the wall reminding you of the merit of the gold standard.

On the other hand, if you live in a country with a responsible Central Bank, say Sweden, that has the oldest central bank in continuous operation since 1668, there is no need for gold. Paper is just fine.

What Mr. Cruz is really saying is that he does not trust the US to have a responsible monetary policy.
